situation.title: Secondary schools
situation.meta_description: Based on governmental measures, in-person education in primary schools is banned until November 20th, 2020.

content.processed:
Rules and recommendations

Based on governmental measures, in-person education in primary schools is banned untilÂ November 20th, 2020. This means that children can't go to school at this time. Children are being taught through distance education.

The reason is the current epidemiological situation and a high risk of infection. A large number of children meet in the classroom for a relatively long period of time, they are also in direct contact with their teachers and parents. This is associated with the risk of transmitting the infection to many contacts.

The children will return to their classrooms as soon as the epidemiological situation allows it.

questions_answers.question: What rules apply for younger children in multiple-year grammar schools (ages 11-15)?
